page.title: 20TRADE-GRIMLEY & SINTON GREEN
page.content: What is notable about both Grimley and Sinton Green is the lack of shops. There are three public houses where items of food and drink may be pur- chased and taken out. For other shop- ping inhabitants have to use their own transport or the bus services to Hallow or Worcester. The milkman makes his delivery 4 days a week. An ice-cream man makes his daily round in the summer. A mobile grocer and baker come every Thursday. Newspapers are delivered daily. If requested you may have deliveries of logs, coal and calor gas. There is a hairdressers for both sexes. The premises was formerly the post office. There is a sub post office in Grimley village but it sells no other items.
